messages.message:
Hey team,
Can we access the ib file system when logged in with our own username <mailto:jemin.jain@instabase.com|jemin.jain@instabase.com>    `system/global/fs/Instabase%20Drive/tools/`  in crafting sandbox?
or its only possible when can logged in with <mailto:noreply+admin@instabase.com|noreply+admin@instabase.com> ?
Facing an error to view the fs when logged in with self account, it is intentional or maybe some error at my end?

You have to be an admin. You can turn on the admin flag for your other account if you like.

It’s not crafting specific; This is just the way the platform works.

Hey how can i turn on the admin flag ?
I tried the following step but still ran into the same error
• Logged in with the admin (<mailto:noreply+admin@instabase.com|noreply+admin@instabase.com>), 
• added <mailto:jemin.jain+crafting-sandbox@instabase.com|jemin.jain+crafting-sandbox@instabase.com> as a member and updated the role to admin
• Logged in with <mailto:jemin.jain+crafting-sandbox@instabase.com|jemin.jain+crafting-sandbox@instabase.com> and tried accessing the fs
Log in as the admin user, and go to /apps/admin  (IB Classic UI) and turn it on for your other user there. Alternatively, you can set `is_admin = true` in the database and then clear the Redis cache.
BTW, since "admin" is overloaded, you need Site Admin permissions (not Org Admin) to access that repo.
